content.description: Short inside corner crack left of Queen's Throne(41), and right of Throne Room(38).  A bit wide at the bottom,  so bring a bigger piece (#4 C4), to protect the bottom, or you can just run it out a bit.
content.protection: Standard Rack. #4 C4 for the bottom wide portion
content.location: Route #40 in the Swartling/Mayer guide book.  Left of Queen's Throne(41) and right of Throne Room(38).  Short inside corner crack, that is a little wide at the bottom.

content.description: Wide-angle inside corner.  Climb left chimney or right crack.
content.location: Located between Colostomy and The Plank.

content.description: Climb the left side of the overhanging face of the tower.
content.location: Left and down of "Barndoor" is this small tower.

content.description: The wide crack to the right of King's Throne. Follow it and it has two finishes. Either the North face or the East face. Fun crack.

The line goes up right of Barn Door from the ground. The moves directly up the thin crack through the mid section require a couple of open handed slaps and a grab in the crack on the left corner.  Pinch a right hand divot and pop for the big ledge then make a not insignificant mantel to stand up and cop a rest.  After this the top is a surprising moderate thin layback flake and move to catch the top.  Be sure to finish the last mantel move to work your shoulders completely.
content.location: The thin crack and face above directly right of Barn Door.  Using the left corner keeps the difficulty consistent.  The line could probably go without the corner and would be about 12a for one move.

content.description: Climb the crack until your entire body fits into it. Chimney to roof and pull roof via thin hand crack.
content.protection: A wide cam low, and a thin hands size piece for the top.
content.location: Route 25 in Sven's Guide. Wide and intimidating crack in the amphitheater just south of Cleo's Needle.

content.description: This one is easy, but it is a whole lot of fun. It is about as perfect for leading as climbs get at Devil's Lake and swallows gear so it is good for the begginner leader. Climb the left facing corner to the right of King's Throne. There are two corners there so climb the one on the right. It is a very vertical crack and ends to the right of the tall rock spike atop the climb.

This is a nice route to do after leading the Queen's Throne (which is an easy and really fun 5.4). Lead up the Queen's Throne. Use some webbing to anchor yourself around the spire at the top. Topside belay your second and have him clean the pitch.  Then dump a #7 cam in one of the big cracks by the belay stance.  There are some smaller cracks closer to the edge that should take a #4 cam. Use the webbing around the spire for your bomber anchor and equalize the two cams for a backup.  I'm sure there are plenty of other ways to set up this top rope, but this worked well for me.  Throw your rope over the edge that faces the lake, rap off, and you're all set to climb.  

  Queen's Face is a wake up call at 5.8 after Queen's Throune at 5.4...but that's a good thing.  Climb the two parallel flared cracks that go almost all the way to the top.  Expect very thin, balancy foot holds.  The crux is pretty close to the ground, around the fourth or fifth move.  There is a real positive rest hold about half way up.  After that, shoot for the top.   

  You could probably lead this, but like I said, the crux is awful close to the ground and it's really easy to set up a top rope.  It's up to you.  Overall, a real nice route. It's worth doing a couple of laps on it.
content.protection: Standard top-rope gear.  Some webbing for sure(a thirty-footer would be nice). I also used a #7 and a #4 cam.

content.description: The traverse is the crux.  There is a horizontal crack that you shuffle your fingers across.  Then reach around the corner with your right hand and pull around the corner.
content.protection: It would be a sketch to lead.  The traverse section has little for protection.  Past the traverse it would be easier to protect.
content.location: The Devil's lake guide book lists this as route 28, The Plank.  Start under the overhang, work your way to the face, then traverse right low around the bulge.

content.description: Start in crack leading to smooth face, balance up face on small holds.
content.location: Behind Tilted Tower on south end of Cleo's Amp.

content.description: Climb is about 5 feet right of Minnie Mum. The meat and potatoes is getting onto the second ledge. Use the small fissure and breaks to work your way up the face to the nice ledge above.
content.location: 5 feet to the right of Minnie mum. Look for the 2 overhangs about half way up.

content.description: Climb the face between Minnie Mouse and Minnie Mum.

This is the last of the routes that end on the ledge on the south side of King's Throne. It is the inside corner. No specific moves as it is low rated and a little boring. Just get into the corner and use what is around to make the easiest ascent.
To the south of King's Throne there is a ledge and two short cracks start from it.  The left crack is Mickey Mouse.  The right crack is Minnie Mouse.  They are good hand/foot cracks.
To the south of King's Throne there is a ledge and two short cracks start from it.  The left crack is Mickey Mouse.  The right crack is Minnie Mouse.  They are good hand/foot cracks.
Start below the shelf of Mickey and Minnie Mouse. Climb up a series of downward sloping ledges, to top out slightly to the left (just barely around the corner).
content.protection: Easy TR ancor on top of King's Throne. Standard rack otherwise. Wasp repellant.
content.location: This is number 36 in the Devil's Lake Guidebook. It is between Missing Link and King's Throne. Approach is the same for Mickey/Minnie Mouse.

content.description: This one can be as hard as a 5.8 for shorter people as it is quite reachy. Just to the right of Minnie Mum on the area that faces East there is a wide crack. Climb to the left of the crack to the top on horizontal cracks and ledges.

The wall is to the right of the gully that runs right and up of Queens Throne. The route is the prominent diagonal crack on the face. The crack runs for around 25 feet and ends on the bottom left side of a small _headwall_. This small _headwall_ (around 10 feet) is the crux of the route and what makes it interesting. Climb it just right of the corner on small edges.
content.protection:
Big nuts (# 10-13) and 1-2 medium size cams (up to 2.5_) for diagonal crack. A Wild Country 1.75_ cam fits nicely on the horizontal crack at the base of the small headwall. To protect the final moves to top out use small size nuts (#2-4) in thin cracks on the face. On top use either tree behind big blocks on summit ledge or big nuts (#9-11) on big blocks sitting on top of the summit ledge. 

  NOTE: The sizes given for nuts correspond to BD stoppers. If using different kind of nuts for pro compare to BD stoppers first to choose the appropriate size. When a size of cam is given the brand is specified to avoid confusion.

content.description: This is a TR just to the right of curved wall. Start with the first 5 to 10 feet of the curved wall 5.8 variation and then go right and straight up the wall. This is a balance act with a mono finger pocket halfway up the wall. This route is not often climbed, but has been done by Steve numerous times.
content.location: Just to the right of the curved wall.

content.description: Climb face to overhang with crack
content.location: right of Big Roof lelf of Better then Dry

content.description: This route starts on the rounded edge of the descent gully and leads you to a ledge.  From the ledge, move left and continue up to the top ledge.
The repulsive inside corner.  It is the inside corner to the left of The Plank by about 10'.  Devil's lake guide book list it as route 26, grade 5.7.
content.protection: There is a good amount of cracks for pro in both the corner and adjacent face.

content.description: Climbs face and big roof left of corner roof, crank thru the middle of the roof crux
content.location: right of the Plank and left of Hang dog

content.description: Climb on or just left of the corner.  The middle section is a bit overhanging.  This is route is listed in the guidebook, third edition, as route 42.
Right side of lichen covered face. Climb straight up passing diagonal crack on upper right end.
content.location: Around the corner to the right from The Plank.

content.description: Starts out with 15 feet of broken rock (large detatched block)and easy moves to a large ledge.  Off ledge climb crack and edges trending left to left side of square buttress top.
content.protection: Gear is more then adequate but maybe slightly blind at crux move at exactly middle mark of route.  Small to middle sized stoppers to small hand sized cams.  Just be sure to protect yourself from the lurking ledge below.
content.location: Prominent crack up highest buttress making up upper rim of Cleo's Amp.  If you are standing at base of Cleo's Needle looking NNW and up at the main access gully this buttress is on the left at about 10 o'clock.

climbs.name: +ULFBERHT+
climbs.fa: TR Erol Altay - Lead Burt Lindquist

content.description: A new route that climbs the wall just left of Colostomy route. Climb up dirty, lichen covered, and mucky big edges to a big horizontal. Reach straight up and side pull the neat little mini arête with both hands then bring the feet up as high as possible. Stab for the obvious little left hand in-cut found in the next small horizontal cleave - match hands - shift feet and finally reach over into the hanging crack to the left. Jam and side pull up the cool fissure to the ledge. Pull the small edges on the outside corner and hoist up to the finishing platforms all while staying away from the small tree and grassy ledge to the left.
content.protection: Protection is very good.  Bunch up a couple good hand sized cams in the horizontal.  Place a #0 Metolius 3 cam in the hanging crack below the small block hold that ends the crux move.  Place large cams in the upper crack.  All good.  You can protect the first 15 feet with gear placements in the start Colostomy.
content.location: Cleo's Amp over on the upper rim wall on the left side as a climber is looking up from Cleo's Needle.  Found on the wall between the routes The Queen's Clam and Colostomy

content.description: The Cleo Amphitheater contains nearly 50 climbs, all of which are relatively easily accessed once inside the Amphitheater.  Well-known climbs here include Queen's Throne (5.4), a perfect inside corner, King's Throne (5.6), and Tilted Tower (5.9+).  Also located within the Amphitheater is Cleopatra's Needle, a 50 foot tower with a wobbly summit block.
